place.name: DARLTON
place.gazetteerText: DARLTON, a parish in East Retford district, Notts; on an affluent of the river Trent, 2 miles NE of Tuxford r. station, and 7½ SE of East Retford. Post town, Tuxford, under Newark. Acres, 1, 507. Real property, £2, 671. Pop., 163. Houses, 39. The living is a p. curacy, annexed to the vicarage of Dunham, in the diocese of Lincoln. The church is good; and there is a Wesleyan chapel. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
